321167489.subject: [ADAMS] Looking for a job?
321167489.text:
Hi everyone,

I wanted to reach out with a full-time job opportunity for anyone
interested in working in a biology lab! This position is especially great
for any graduating seniors looking for some more lab experience before
going on to graduate school/medical school. The Buratowski lab, which is in
the BCMP department at Harvard Medical School, is looking for a lab
technician/research assistant, with a possibility to start as early as this
month. The application details as well as more information about the
position are in the document I have attached to this email.

I have been conducting research in the Buratowski lab since last summer and
cannot say enough about how great of a lab it is. We are pretty small,
which makes it a really close-knit environment where everyone is very
collaborative. Steve, the PI, is extremely accessible, and you would get to
be very involved in the research. Additionally, depending on how long you
plan to stay, Steve is very open to techs overseeing projects of their own.
Happy to answer any questions, as is Steve, about the lab environment or
the position itself!

Best,
Brynn

_______________________________________________
Check the Adams FAQ for answers to many common questions: http://adamshouse.harvard.edu/frequently-asked-questions
***List emails may not be reproduced, retransmitted, or otherwise republished without the express written consent of the author.

adams-schmooze mailing list
adams-schmooze@lists.hcs.harvard.edu
https://lists.hcs.harvard.edu/mailman/listinfo/adams-schmooze

1823576596.subject: Inside SEAS: Design Fair, Awards, and more
1823576596.text:
May 1, 2023


** April 24, 2023
------------------------------------------------------------


** IN THIS ISSUE
------------------------------------------------------------
* News & Announcements (#news)
* SEAS Community Events (#communityevents)
* Harvard Events (#harvardevents)


** News & Announcements
------------------------------------------------------------


** SEC Late Night Café free food
------------------------------------------------------------
Once a week from 7-9:15 p.m., the SEC Café offers a free item as part of their evening service. The free item for Wednesday, April 26 is:
* Brownie Sundae


** REEF Makerspace Innovation Fund for faculty and staff
------------------------------------------------------------
Thanks to generous support provided by SEAS Community Connections Fund, The REEF Makerspace in the SEC is excited to announce they are now accepting applications from SEAS staff and faculty to create and make personal projects to be worked on over the summer.

They are looking for innovative and creative proposals that showcase skills and passions. Once approved, the REEF staff will be able to meet with individuals accepted into the program to discuss project designs and provide feedback.

To help bring your project to life, the REEF is offering funding up to $300. In addition to financial support, accepted proposals will receive assistance from experienced staff in areas such as material purchasing, machinery, software training, and engineering support. They are committed to ensuring that your project is a success and will work closely with you throughout the process.
Don’t miss this opportunity to turn your ideas into reality with the support of the REEF. Submit your proposal (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeqkZHAACwBfjwdNGC9i9iBADX8r5P4Rk8_lGsuGUK4oSpivA/viewform?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381) and take your first step towards bringing your vision to life. The deadline to apply is Friday, May 5. Community members will hear back by mid-May on accepted projects.


** Call for applications: New World Social Innovation Fellows
------------------------------------------------------------
The New World Social Innovation Fellows Program (https://sici.hks.harvard.edu/homepage/new-world-social-innovation-fellowship/?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)  is a rigorous co-curricular program for change-makers committed to addressing critical social problems in new and creative ways. The Fellows Program supports selected students – known as Cheng Fellows – advancing progress on a social problem through an effort of their own design. Through weekly co-curricular programming, coaching, mentoring, and seed funding, the Fellowship provides a platform for students to explore, develop, and scale efforts while in school and post-graduation. Collectively, Fellows’ work represents innovation across issues, around the world, and within sectors - encompassing civil society, business, government, and NGO organizations.

Applicants from SEAS master’s programs must graduate in Spring 2024. Doctoral students may apply as rising second-year students or rising third-year students (Spring 2026 or 2027 graduation). The application for this program opens Friday, May 5, and closes Monday, June 5.


** SEAS Community Events
------------------------------------------------------------


** April 25, May 17: Bike events
------------------------------------------------------------
Harvard CommuterChoice is hosting a couple bike-themed events (including one at the SEC) this semester.

Bike Maintenance Basics Workshop
* 10-minute tune-ups and bike safety checks
* Bring your bikes and bike parts to work 1:1 with a bike mechanic
* Register your bike or micromobility device

Date: Tuesday, April 25
Time: 1:30 - 3:30 p.m.
Location: SEC Makerspace, 150 Western Ave., Allston

Annual Bike Breakfast
* 10-minute tune-ups and bike safety checks
* Register your bike or micromobility device
* Enter to win bike prizes
* Breakfast catered by Oggi's

Date: Wednesday, May 17
Time: 8 - 10 a.m.
Location: Smith Campus Center patio, 75 Mt. Auburn Street, Cambridge


** May 22 - 25: Commencement Affinity Celebrations (https://edib.harvard.edu/affinity-graduations?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
------------------------------------------------------------
Affinity celebrations are student-led, staff supported events that recognize and celebrate the accomplishments of graduates from marginalized and underrepresented communities. These University-wide celebrations provide an opportunity for graduates to honor those who have helped them achieve their milestone while centering their cultural traditions and values. Affinity celebrations are open to all Harvard graduates who pre-register to attend. The celebrations include keynote speakers, performances and cultural celebrations.

Registration for the 2023 Affinity Celebrations will close on Monday, April 24. If you have questions, please contact edib@harvard.edu (mailto:edib@harvard.edu) .


** [See all SEAS events] (https://events.seas.harvard.edu/?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
------------------------------------------------------------


** Harvard Events
------------------------------------------------------------


** April 27: HMSC 10-Year Anniversary (https://hmsc.harvard.edu/calendar_event/anniversary-celebration/?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
------------------------------------------------------------
Celebrate the 10-Year Anniversary of the Harvard Museums of Science & Culture (HMSC) by visiting one or all four HMSC museums to collect museum swag, enjoy birthday cupcakes, participate in raffles, or explore galleries. HMSC is free for Harvard ID holders.



** April 27-30: ARTS FIRST (https://ofa.fas.harvard.edu/arts-first-2023-events?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
------------------------------------------------------------
ARTS FIRST is Harvard's annual showcase of student, faculty, and Harvard affiliate creativity. Produced by the Office for the Arts, with support from the Board of Overseers of Harvard University, the festival is a public event with many free performances and activities for Harvard and community members of all ages.



** May 8: Creating the Climate Future: Harvard Climate Leadership Summit (https://www.harvardcls.com/index.php?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
------------------------------------------------------------
All Harvard students are invited to attend the inaugural Harvard Climate Leadership Summit during Harvard Climate Action Week (May 8 - 12). The summit will provide a platform that convenes students and decision-makers across industry, government and civil society to cultivate a rising generation of climate leadership. There will be an opportunity to meet the Emerging Climate Leaders, a passionate and diverse group of students who are dedicated to tackling climate change. They are the next generation of leaders committed to building a more sustainable and equitable future.



** May 9: Harvard Climate Symposium (https://harvardclimatesymposium.cventevents.com/event/c2f2acd5-bd80-49de-b1d3-4206bc0c7c76/summary?rp=b485e4a4-efad-42bf-9efc-e57a893288f1&utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
------------------------------------------------------------
The Salata Institute for Climate and Sustainability is hosting a Climate Symposium during Harvard Climate Action Week (May 8 - 12). This new Institute serves as a fulcrum for collaboration across Harvard’s many areas of expertise, pursuing practical, real-world solutions that address all aspects of the climate crisis.

The Symposium represents the first major event of the Salata Institute’s Climate Action Accelerator (https://salatainstitute.harvard.edu/the-accelerator/?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381) . The Accelerator will serve as a resource and partner to the full spectrum of stakeholders wrestling with the most difficult and divisive climate questions, building consensus for climate solutions grounded in Harvard’s research and expertise.


** SEAS suggestion box
------------------------------------------------------------
SEAS welcomes your ideas for ways to improve the school, build community, and make things work more efficiently. Submit feedback, suggestions, or ideas (https://harvard.az1.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_ah3D4tyjx30av5z?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381) . Include your name if you wish; otherwise all submissions are anonymous.


** Submit your news to Inside SEAS
------------------------------------------------------------
Inside SEAS is published weekly. If you would like to have news featured in future editions, please email Matt Goisman (mailto:mgoisman@g.harvard.edu?subject=Inside%20SEAS%20Submission) by 5 p.m. on Thursdays. Inside SEAS can help you share news and announcements with a wider audience.

While we make every effort to publish all items received, the editorial staff reserves the right to reject submissions and edit content for space and style.

============================================================
** Website (https://www.seas.harvard.edu?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
** Website (https://www.seas.harvard.edu?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
** Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/hseas?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
** Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/hseas?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
** Twitter (https://twitter.com/hseas?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
** Twitter (https://twitter.com/hseas?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
** YouTube (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCeOqa_ZbKo88RmL5z8Oz5Ww?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
** YouTube (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCeOqa_ZbKo88RmL5z8Oz5Ww?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
** Instagram (http://instagram.com/harvardseas?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
** Instagram (http://instagram.com/harvardseas?utm_source=SEAS+Community&utm_campaign=5d5defddaa-InsideSEAS_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_4c60eab88d-5d5defddaa-430354381)
** unsubscribe from this list (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/unsubscribe?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=4c60eab88d&e=65d2b2b7c0&c=5d5defddaa)

1833645927.subject: SEAS Undergraduate Career Newsletter Monday, May 1, 2023
1833645927.text:
View this email in your browser (https://mailchi.mp/seas/seas-undergraduate-career-newsletter-mon-may-1-2023-33?e=65d2b2b7c0)
https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=e87a3fa3e3&e=65d2b2b7c0


** Table of Contents
------------------------------------------------------------
1. Personalized Information (#Appointment Links)
2. Announcements (#Announcements)
3. Employer, Career, and Academic Events (#Events)
4. Selected Job Postings (#Jobs)
5. Harvard Center Links Useful for Careers (#Harvard Center Links)
6. Other Lists (#Lists)
7. Contact Information (#Contact Information)


** Personalized Information
------------------------------------------------------------

Calendly link to schedule a 25-minute appointment (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=59dd52faa4&e=65d2b2b7c0)  with Keith Karasek (kkarasek@seas.harvard.edu ; SEC LL1.237) to discuss your career, internship, and job-search goals.

Email Ruth Sondermann (sonderm@g.harvard.edu) for advice regarding opportunities in European countries

SEAS Student Career Development (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=568c4dadc0&e=65d2b2b7c0)

Talk to students in concentration areas:
Applied Mathematics Peer Concentration Advisors (PCAs) (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=0c18ca6fc6&e=65d2b2b7c0)
Computer Science Peer Concentration Advisors (PCAs) (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=b69915eb32&e=65d2b2b7c0)
Engineering Peer Concentration Advisors (PCAs) (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=c3da894ca0&e=65d2b2b7c0)


** Announcements
------------------------------------------------------------



** Wednesday - SEAS Design & Project Fair
------------------------------------------------------------
The SEC will host the annual SEAS Design & Project Fair on Wednesday from 11-2:30 p.m. Students from literally dozens of SEAS design and engineering classes are participating, and will be displaying devices, contraptions, apps, robots and all manner of innovative creations designed, prototyped, and fabricated in SEAS labs to solve interesting problems. Plus, free food!



** “Science behind Chip Manufacturing” - TSMC Talk
------------------------------------------------------------
TSMC (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.) is the world’s largest semiconductor foundry. Semiconductors have become increasingly critical in all aspects of society.  Dr. Jun He, TSMC Vice President, will present a seminar next Monday, April 8, 2023 (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=5156087fc2&e=65d2b2b7c0) , at 2pm in Pierce 209 in which he will discuss how science enables advanced semiconductor fabrication.



** CS Grad School & Thesis Events
------------------------------------------------------------
You will see two CS-advising events on the schedule early this week.
* Grad School (for PhD) Information Session
+ This was held this morning at 11am.  We can't send out the recording until captions are inserted, but here is the If you missed it, here is the 2021 recording (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=7dd1e312e7&e=65d2b2b7c0 ) (passcode !5cXFjrS).
* Thesis Panel Information Session:
+ Hear from some of our thesis writers and learn the general timeline of writing a thesis.
+ Donuts and coffee provided
+ Tomorrow, Tuesday, May 2, 2023, at 11am in SEC 3.302&3.30


** Harvard GRID Announcements
------------------------------------------------------------
* 4-6pm,Tuesday, May 9, 2023, LLL Series: Tender Food and Lowercarbon Capital (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=da9faa19b9&e=65d2b2b7c0) , SEC 2.203
* 12-2pm, Wednesday, May 10, 2023, L2M Office Hours (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=6d1929229a&e=65d2b2b7c0) , SEC 2.203
* 6:30-8:15pm, Thursday, May 11, 2023, The Future of Sensors, Implants and Wearables in Healthcare (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=1224dc376b&e=65d2b2b7c0) (limited availability)

Also check out these select I-Lab Events (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=7f509a31bf&e=65d2b2b7c0) :
* Wednesday, May 3, 2023, 6-7pm, 2023 Harvard President's Innovation Challenge Awards Ceremony (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=1b41b4f7c1&e=65d2b2b7c0) , Klarman Hall, Register (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=cf5d695c1c&e=65d2b2b7c0)


** Student Club Announcement
------------------------------------------------------------
The Harvard Computer Society AI Group and Harvard Undergraduate Machine Intelligence Community are offering a Vision Fellowship program (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=b2b6e68a71&e=65d2b2b7c0) this summer that promotes independent initiatives in AI and machine learning for personal learning and broader impact. A commitment of 5-10 hours per week on projects/development is expected. Applications (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=536d0a0f51&e=65d2b2b7c0) close May 10.


**
Ruth's Corner
------------------------------------------------------------
It appears that 2023 is a difficult year to find a summer internship in Europe. There are still internships to be had at this date, but you need to make sure that the internship salary or stipend will cover your costs (i.e., don't expect Harvard or outside subsidies). I continue to list some on Crimson Careers. A few suggestions:

Have a great cover letter.
Sign up for the company's newsletter.  Read their published reports/newsletter to gain more insight into the company and find a contact at the company that way.  This information could provide a great starting sentence for your cover letter.

Use key words or phrasing that the company uses.
If a company such Altman Solon (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=88187a707a&e=65d2b2b7c0) (which has three internships listed: Strategy Intern in Milan/Italy, (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=a242d79308&e=65d2b2b7c0) Research intern, (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=e0d5260bab&e=65d2b2b7c0) and Strategy Intern Munich) (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=745905f01b&e=65d2b2b7c0) is talking about "Consultants" ,"Services" and "Expertise," then you should use these terms in your cover letter and maybe even in your resume.

Expand your internship search beyond a certain geographical area.
Many European companies have international subsidiaries. If your goal was to be in Europe this summer, you might still find an internship with the same company, but in a different location. A good example would be Zeiss (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=93da6237b9&e=65d2b2b7c0) , which offers internships worldwide.

Use different search terms and consider industries that you have not considered before.
Here are a few companies that offer internships:
Rocket Factory Augsburg (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=8eaadd9afd&e=65d2b2b7c0)  - international space start-up company.
SAP (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=45cbbc761e&e=65d2b2b7c0)

Companies are not always offering internships online, and deadlines are sometimes missing in the descriptions of those that are.  Find companies that are of interest to you and apply - even if there are no internships advertised.


** Monday, May 1, 2023
------------------------------------------------------------
11am-noon, CS Grad School Info Session, zoom (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=091483e617&e=65d2b2b7c0)
12-1pm, Tech Recruiting: Job and Internship Success Series (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=3785c39dd4&e=65d2b2b7c0)
3-5pm, Case in Point Workshop with Marc Cosentino (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=41a9ddb232&e=65d2b2b7c0)
6:30-8pm, HUCEG (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=737ffa3fc5&e=65d2b2b7c0) Final Celebration, HUCE 440


** Tuesday, May 2, 2023
------------------------------------------------------------
11am-noon, CS Thesis Panel Information Session, SEC 3.302&3.303


** Wednesday, May 3, 2023
------------------------------------------------------------
10-11am, 2024 Medical School Application Q&A (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=70ae8d3e6a&e=65d2b2b7c0)
11am-2:30pm, SEAS Design & Project Fair, SEC First Floor
12:30-1:30pm, Public Service Job Search Meetup for Seniors (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=22ff01b685&e=65d2b2b7c0) , PBHA, Parlor Room
6-7pm, 2023 Harvard President's Innovation Challenge Awards Ceremony (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=411be3362e&e=65d2b2b7c0) , Klarman Hall, Register (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=aa576e5e43&e=65d2b2b7c0)


** Thursday, May 4, 2023
------------------------------------------------------------
3:30-5:30pm, Fab Thursday - Legos and Easy-to-make Clay Mother's Day Gifts, Maker Space SEC 1.112
6-7pm, Emerging Femtech Presents: From Infertile PhD to PherDal (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=0104dcf7ea&e=65d2b2b7c0)


** Friday, May 5, 2023
------------------------------------------------------------
x


** Monday, May 8, 2023
------------------------------------------------------------
8am-5pm, Harvard Climate Leadership Summit (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=0e8afe0834&e=65d2b2b7c0) , 79 JFK St.
2-3pm, TSMC talk: Science Behind Chip Manufacturing (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=1540bbe0ff&e=65d2b2b7c0) , Pierce 209


** Tuesday, May 9, 2023
------------------------------------------------------------
4-6pm, [GRID (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=4de8a5a52c&e=65d2b2b7c0) ] LLL Series: Tender Food and Lowercarbon Capital (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=4af370d78e&e=65d2b2b7c0) , SEC 2.203


** Wednesday, May 10, 2023
------------------------------------------------------------
12-2pm, [GRID (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=1530a91743&e=65d2b2b7c0) ] L2M Office Hours (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=a9b1f67636&e=65d2b2b7c0) , SEC 2.203
4-5pm, 2024 Medical School Application Q&A (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=70408d5a31&e=65d2b2b7c0)


** Thursday, May 11, 2023
------------------------------------------------------------
11am-3pm, City Career Fair: Diversity Employment Day Career Fair & Roundtables (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=88fa3fa639&e=65d2b2b7c0) ,  AC Hotel by Marriott Boston Downtown 225 Albany Street Boston
3:30-6pm, MassRobotics: Career Fair (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=011e88aaae&e=65d2b2b7c0) ,  Boston Convention and Exhibition Center
6:30-8:15pm, [GRID (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=a0e3f473bd&e=65d2b2b7c0) ] The Future of Sensors, Implants and Wearables in Healthcare (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=5cbaadf648&e=65d2b2b7c0) (limited availability)


** Selected Job Postings
------------------------------------------------------------


** Internship Positions (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=3f664bd664&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------


** Government Lab Internships and Jobs (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=5813de1800&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------



** Post-Graduate Jobs (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=4a48705b07&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------



** Grad School Info Sessions (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=a03dba9470&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------



** Harvard Office of Technology Development Emerging Startups (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=d3d36fac99&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------

Y Combinator Startup Directory (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=4b6bdeee72&e=65d2b2b7c0) and Jobs List (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=6128c83097&e=65d2b2b7c0)
YC Summer Conference - (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=8391fd25dc&e=65d2b2b7c0) Saturday, June 17, 2023



** Harvard I-Lab Current Venture Teams (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=31522803dc&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------


** Harvard Center Links Useful for Careers
------------------------------------------------------------


** FAS Office of Career Services Home Page (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=3d8be72e4d&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------
There are a LOT of resources at this site, so please explore.



** OCS Career Pathways Page (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=b201ec92e1&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------
The OCS pathways are organized by area. Each has a curated set of jobs/internships taken from CC.



** Recorded OCS Webinars (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=9adb48786c&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------
These are open to the Harvard community, but they ask that you not share the links.



** Academic Resource Center Calendar (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=747188c57a&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------



** Undergraduate Research and Fellowships Office Upcoming Events (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=06a4415a25&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------


** Other Lists
------------------------------------------------------------


** Scholarships, Fellowships, Conferences and Other Programs (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=6eeba2c46b&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------
Game Music and Audio Conference  at Berklee College of Music


** Selected Hackathons, Competitions, etc. (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=92f42eea9b&e=65d2b2b7c0)
------------------------------------------------------------
High-Voltage Direct Current Prize

SEAS-Affiliated Student Clubs (https://harvard.us1.list-manage.com/track/click?u=598d73b470a40f403bba4fb2c&id=6dbd88a012&e=65d2b2b7c0)


** Contact Information
------------------------------------------------------------

Director of Experiential and Career Development
Science and Engineering Complex LL1-237, 617-495-5073
kkarasek@seas.harvard.edu (mailto:kkarasek@seas.harvard.edu) (primary)
kkarasek@g.harvard.edu (mailto:kkarasek@g.harvard.edu) (for Google Hangouts & Google docs)

Ruth Sondermann
sonderm@g.harvard.edu

-1701827262.subject: [ADAMS] Fwd: [NSA] THIS SAT: KUUMBA SPRING CONCERT 5/6 @8PM
-1701827262.text:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Seychelle Doyley <seychelledoyley@college.harvard.edu>
Date: Mon, 1 May 2023 at 11:45
Subject: [NSA] THIS SAT: KUUMBA SPRING CONCERT 5/6 @8PM
To: <throptalk@lists.hcs.harvard.edu>, HCC <hcclist@lists.hcs.harvard.edu>,
BSA List <bsa-list@lists.fas.harvard.edu>, NSA List <
nsa-list@lists.hcs.harvard.edu>, ABHW Email List (2) <
abhw-list@lists.hcs.harvard.edu>, hsbse-list <
hsbse-list@lists.hcs.harvard.edu>


*The Kuumba Singers of Harvard College Presents *


‘Free At Last'
*The Half-Century Celebration Concert*

 [image: FINAL KUUMBA POSTER.png]

Saturday, May 6th, 2023
8:00 PM, Doors open at 7:00 PM
Sanders Theatre
45 Quincy St, Cambridge, MA 02138
<https://www.google.com/maps/search/45+Quincy+St,+Cambridge,+MA+02138?entry=gmail&source=g>
$15 for HUID holders, $20 for the general population
**LIMITED NUMBER OF TICKETS AVAILABLE**
*SEF eligible!*


Reserve tickets online
<https://www.boxoffice.harvard.edu/Online/default.asp?BOparam::WScontent::loadArticle::permalink=kuumba>
or at the Harvard Box Office
<https://www.boxoffice.harvard.edu/Online/default.asp?BOparam::WScontent::loadArticle::permalink=hours-location&BOparam::WScontent::loadArticle::context_id=>
.
Note: All online reservations will incur a $3.50 handling fee, no fees in
person at the box office.

BREAKING NEWS


TREASURY SECRETARY JANET YELLEN SAID THE U.S. COULD BE UNABLE TO PAY ITS BILLS
BY JUNE 1 IF CONGRESS DOES NOT RAISE OR SUSPEND THE DEBT LIMIT.
[https://nl.nytimes.com/f/newsletter/0p5a5AEJi4N7X2QFo53KmA~~/AAAAAQA~/RgRmMqd2P0TsaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnl0aW1lcy5jb20vMjAyMy8wNS8wMS91cy9wb2xpdGljcy9kZWJ0LWxpbWl0LWRhdGUtamFuZXQteWVsbGVuLmh0bWw_Y2FtcGFpZ25faWQ9NjAmZW1jPWVkaXRfbmFfMjAyMzA1MDEmaW5zdGFuY2VfaWQ9MCZubD1icmVha2luZy1uZXdzJnJlZj1oZWFkbGluZSZyZWdpX2lkPTk4MTA5MTY4JnNlZ21lbnRfaWQ9MTMxODQwJnVzZXJfaWQ9YmEyZmY2OWVkNmU5ZmVjNmYzMWYzMjJjZTUzNGJkMTVXA255dEIKZEl2IlBkh5uqMFIfZWVsYWFmemFoaWRAY29sbGVnZS5oYXJ2YXJkLmVkdVgEAAAAAA~~]

Monday, May 1, 2023 4:30 PM ET

The warning provides new urgency for Democrats and Republicans to find a way to
lift the borrowing cap and break a standoff that threatens to rock financial
markets and upend the economy.

Read more
[https://nl.nytimes.com/f/newsletter/mzmtuihjA45tNGYz_TNQGQ~~/AAAAAQA~/RgRmMqd2P0TnaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubnl0aW1lcy5jb20vMjAyMy8wNS8wMS91cy9wb2xpdGljcy9kZWJ0LWxpbWl0LWRhdGUtamFuZXQteWVsbGVuLmh0bWw_Y2FtcGFpZ25faWQ9NjAmZW1jPWVkaXRfbmFfMjAyMzA1MDEmaW5zdGFuY2VfaWQ9MCZubD1icmVha2luZy1uZXdzJnJlZj1jdGEmcmVnaV9pZD05ODEwOTE2OCZzZWdtZW50X2lkPTEzMTg0MCZ1c2VyX2lkPWJhMmZmNjllZDZlOWZlYzZmMzFmMzIyY2U1MzRiZDE1VwNueXRCCmRJdiJQZIebqjBSH2VlbGFhZnphaGlkQGNvbGxlZ2UuaGFydmFyZC5lZHVYBAAAAAA~]
